why: Pacing helps you build activity tolerance gradually without triggering flare-ups or setbacks.

slides.title: Pacing Strategies
slides.content: Pacing means gradually increasing activity while staying within your body's current tolerance levels

slides.title: The 50% Rule
slides.content: Start with 50% of what you think you can do, then gradually increase by 10-20% weekly if no flare-ups

slides.title: Activity Planning
slides.content: Break activities into smaller chunks; take regular breaks; alternate between different types of tasks

slides.title: Flare-Up Prevention
slides.content: Listen to early warning signs; stop before you're exhausted; plan rest periods throughout the day

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Push through pain to build tolerance. Fact: Gradual pacing prevents setbacks and builds confidence.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: Plan tomorrow's activities using the 50% rule; schedule regular breaks every 30-45 minutes
